column1: short and wide outside off, cut straight to point

slapped straight to deep midwicket! My word did the connect on that, but it was flat and it was straight to Krunal. A length ball wide outside off, trying to get him to hit into the off side. But he's used his reach to pummel this slog sweep on the up. But it's joy for India
beaten. Short and skidding straight on in the corridor. Looks to cut for the one that turns but is done by the bounce
tossed up at off stump, soft-handed drop into the covers to steal a single
length and flat at middle stump, hardly a stride as he defends off the outside half of the bat
past the keeper down leg side. Another straighter one but this starts leg stump and goes on with the angle
tossed up wide outside off, drilled square off the front foot but Rohit is agile at backward point. Down quickly to stop
short of a length, slammed in wide outside off. Steps out and has a slash at it but that keeps going away from him and is past the bat
length ball down leg side, can't connect with the attempted flick
at the stumps and poked into the off side
beaten. Brings out the slower, possibly the knuckle ball. At a length and in the corridor. Looks for the big slog but that's past the inside edge
length on off stump, leans in and steers on the rise to mid-off's right
length on off stump, watchfully pushed down the pitch off the back foot

onto the stumps! Knuckle ball! Bat, pad, off stump. Once again, gets the line and length spot on outside off, in the corridor. And with that variation, he gets the batsman swinging through it too early as well. Again, trying to go leg side. But it's an inside edge and it's all very ugly by the end of it. Not for India though
nicely behind this. No irreverent slogging this time. Short of a length at middle stump, onto the back foot and a controlled pull to beat deep midwicket to his left
oh beautiful. One of cricket's most attractive batsmen at the moment. Length ball tossed up outside off, reaches out and just uses quick wrists to whip-drive this way over the straight boundary
length on leg stump, deflected into the leg side off the back foot
falls short. Tossed up wide outside off, slow and loopy. Looks to drive but he's not to the pitch. Thick outside edge falls between backward point and short third man
length on leg stump, onto the back foot to whip to deep midwicket
length outside off, walks down the pitch and defends to the bowler
length outside off, walks down again and flicks off the inside half to fine leg's left
length outside off, skips down to try and drive. Deflected to midwicket off the inside edge
length and just outside off. Walks down and defends to mid-on
length outside off, shuffles and flicks to square leg
survives lbw because he's way down the pitch and outside off stump as he tries to flick this. Then gets back just in time as cover gets a direct hit in that's deflected towards fine leg
length on middle stump, leans in and flicks to midwicket

clears the straight boundary. Just squeezes it out from the mid-riff area and pulls straight over the bowler. Goes 83 metres. Short of a length ball at off stump, not much room, but the extra pace helps
short of a length on middle stump, defended to point

top edge and taken! And a send off that will get much better as he gets more experience from a very awkward Saini. Short of a length at off stump, wants to cart this through midwicket but it only gets as far as about ten yards behind the stumps. Pant gets under it and holds on at shin height

bowled him! Saini is on a hat-trick on debut! Short ball just outside off stump. He leaps off the floor and wants to stab this past wide slip for the single. But he's through it early and the ball is off the face of the bat and straight into off stump
left alone. Length and delicious outside off for the cover drive but Rovman is focused
left alone. Starts off with an offcutter. Short and wide outside off. Pollard walks in at it but it gets awkward fast. Lets it go
short of a length on leg stump, dropped into the square leg region off the back foot
beaten. Nice lift off a length there. Angled across. Rovman pokes at it and is beaten
shot! Shorter and wider outside off this time and he gets a half stride in and slaps this past backward point
short and in the corridor. Drops the hands and lets it go. That dips on Pant a touch as it reaches him

nicely taken by Pant diving forward! The previous ball, a bouncer, dipped on him. This, a slower ball, practically needed him to lunge as soon as Powell looked to hammer this. Length and wide and climbing to kiss the outside edge. Pant goes low and forward towards his right and pouches this
136kph, length and slanted in to the corridor. Nervously pushed into the leg side with hard hands
bouncer at a leg stump line, ducks under it and lets it go
short of a length on leg stump, looks to flick and this raps his thigh guard
short and wide outside off, mistimed cut rolls out to extra cover
140kph, short and down leg side. Pollard is down the track as he leaves this. Not called wide
called wide this time. Length and down leg side. Beaten on the flick after walking down
length and just outside off, 137kph. Can only nudge this to backward point
short of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length on off stump, opens the face and runs it down
offcutter at a length on middle stump. Watchfully turned through square leg
short of a length at off stump, sliced to third man
length outside off, nice big stride forward to drive to extra cover
nicely bowled. Offcutter wide outside off at a length. Looks to drive and is beaten
length outside off, wants to push this through the covers. Inside edge into the pitch
length at off stump, blocked on the front foot
arm ball at a length on off. Defended off the inside edge
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
outside edge dribbles past short third. Slip had come out to protect an economical over. Fuller and faster outside off, he drives from inside the line and is safe in the end
length on off, punched to long-off on the up
length on off stump, defended into the leg side
length on leg stump, flicked to deep square
short of a length outside off, chopped to backward point
full on middle stump, defended down the pitch
arm ball fired in at a length in the corridor, sliced to point
length on leg stump, nudged behind square off the front front foot
drifts in a length ball, Carlos gets well forward and defends
fired full, hint of turn, pushed back
bite off the deck, drew him forward, good ball! Stabbed away
length ball, pushed through quicker, punched back to the bowler
slower through the air, nice loop, he gets well forward and defends with the help of an inside edge
angled in from wide of the crease, he gets forward and defends again
punched to long-on
nudges it gently into the leg side for a quick single, Pant ran across to stop that
punched back, good stop off his own bowling

steps out and goes through with the stroke to clear the ropes! Straight hit. The bottom hand came off the bat as he made contact, didn't get to the pitch because Jadeja pulled it back but such is Pollard's reach and power. They need more of this
punched to long-on
fired full, defended back

beauty! Drift from around the stumps followed by sharp turn to beat Pollard's feeble push. Stumping appeal that forces the square leg umpire to check upstairs. All good. The back foot was in the air for a split-second before it came down in the nick of time.
flatter on middle, eased to long-on
too short, easy pickings, punched to long-on
appeal for lbw as he plays all around this indrifter, may have been slipping down
whips it a long, long way into the stands. Brute force, muscle and whatever. Just a touch too full and Pollard picks it effortlessly.
turns this back past the bowler as they scamper through
fired full, defended back
fizzes off the deck, but there for the whack as it was short, Pollard has a huge swipe but misses
skids one back in, hurried through to beat Pollard's attempted whip, hit on the pad.
slaps this down to long-off
shortish but there's sharp turn too, punched to cover
works this with the angle to the man coming in from deep midwicket
gets a thick outside edge as he looks to flick over mdiwicket, beat Dhawan at short third man instead

excellent catch! Brathwaite plays a flat-batted pull, was travelling but Krunal held on as he moved swiftly to his left. Spongy bounce, I thought, held onto the surface which made manufacturing the shot a bit difficult, in the end he didn't get the power he would've liked.
nearly chipped to short midwicket!
pulled, one bounce to deep midwicket. Didn't connect
width outside off, reaches out to drill this to sweeper cover
slaps this down to long-off where Pandey fumbles, but no damage done

pulled but a fine catch at the boundary by Khaleel running to his right from deep square. He dropped short, Narine took him on, but didn't get the power he wanted. Khaleel nearly ran in a bit too much but recovered and then held his balance as he back-tracked.
lunges forward and stabs this full delivery
quicker one on off, pushed back
bounce from length on middle, defended from the crease
kept low, but he manages to stay behind the line and defend
fired full, drifting in, kept out
slower length ball angling in, he walks across and flicks to deep backward square
leg-cutter on a length outside off, eased to point
bails out of this slower bouncer which he looked to fetch from outside off
mistimes this hoick to midwicket, no one there and Bhuvi was labouring behind that, two easy
he's clobbered this alright. Bisects deep square and deep midwicket. Slower length ball, Pollard held his shape and made proper contact
slower and fuller on off, defended back
hustles him for pace with this snorter of a short ball, rapped on the glove as he hops back
right into the blockhole, squeezed out
high full toss, mistimed to mid-off for a quick single
heaves this deep into the stands at deep midwicket. Waist-high nearly, Pollard was waiting for it. Yorker gone wrong
not enough bat on this high full toss again, squirted to midwicket
slash and a miss, banged in too short and way too wide. Good call
hit hard to mid-off

very nicely held by Kohli! India continue to march on. Looking to pull, gets it very high on the bat as this skews to the off side with the bat face turning in his hand. Kohli runs to his right from cover to pouch this
whips to deep midwicket and refuses the single. Cottrell has more matches than runs
squeezed to long-off, refuses to run again
gone! Way over deep square. Banged in short, appeared as if it got too steep for him to pull at one point but he took him on and got enough wood. Incredible hit!
mistimes the hoick to long-on
dropped! Pandey from wide long-on came in a long way and was off balance as he missed this. Tough chance, great effort. No runs taken. Pollard will be on strike
beaten as he looks to reach out and squeeze behind point
goes wide yorker again, Pollard beaten as he tries to guide this past short third man

beaten as he looks to hoick this across the line. No one appealed, except for Rishabh Pant and Kohli goes upstairs. This hit him on the full, flush on the right thigh and replays confirm this would've crashed into the top of off stump. Decision overturned, given out.
beaten for pace, excellent bouncer. Cramped for room as he took him on with the pull
high full toss, mistimed to cover
backs away to pull but is beaten. Saini finishes off with a wicket-maiden and India need 96 to go 1-0 up.
short of a length on off stump, inside edge onto pad as he looks to defend
length on leg stump, leans in and pokes to midwicket
length on off stump, dropped pitch side on the off side to steal a run
short at off stump, allows it to come on and steers to third man
beaten edge. Short and wide outside off, swipes away from the body and misses
full toss on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length in the corridor, sliced to backward point
length outside off, blocked on the front foot
length and wide outside off, left alone
length at off stump, defended into the covers
short of a length outside off, sliced to backward point
full and down leg side, left alone
length at off stump, punched towards mid-off
that looks plumb! Out comes the salute. Dhawan with an ungainly hack across the line at a length ball. It strikes him right in front of middle and he won't bother reviewing that
length on leg stump, defended off the back foot
top edge sails over the fine boundary. That bouncer hurries onto him at the helmet and he swipes from underneath. A scene Oshane has probably seen a lot in T20s
length at off stump, defended off the back foot
falls short of Cottrell at third man. Another short ball, this time outside off. Wants to ramp this and nearly picks the man out. He dives forward and manages to keep it to one
length at middle stump, defended off the back foot
length on middle, defended into the leg side
full outside off, looks to drive but that doesn't quite come on. Inside edge rolls into the leg side
full and wide outside off, looks to chop it behind square and is beaten
in-dipping yorker at off stump. Keeps the forward stride out of the way and gets it down to third man off the outside of the bat
full on middle stump, looks to flick, leading edge out to deep point
length outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
another in-diping yorker at off stump. Watchfully defended to point
full outside off, gets forward and flicks to long-on
shot. Dropped short and just outside off. Makes some room on the back foot and chops it between point and short third
lbw appeal is turned down. Offbreak at a length on middle stump, looks for the slog sweep and is struck on the back leg in front of leg stump. Not reviewed
length on leg stump, flicked to midwicket
short of a length on middle, punched towards long-on. Midwicket dives to his left and gets close to induce some doubt. But it's not stopped cleanly
short of a length on middle, punched to long-on
full at middle stump, plants the front leg across and tries to whip this into the leg side. Thick inside edge out to deep square
slugged to the wide long-on boundary. Still not coming on and this too is off the inside part of the bat. Length ball on middle and he has to drag this
length ball pushed across off stump, chopped on the bounce to point
crunched! Wow! That is a stunning hit on this pitch. A lofted cover drive for six. Full and wide, stride down the pitch and a full flow of the arms. Superb
slower ball on off stump, defended on the front foot
slower ball at a length on off stump, punched to mid-off
tucked wide of midwicket
dabbed late to point

holes out to long-on. Uncharacteristic shot from Rohit, looking to clear the ropes but didn't quite get underneath the length. This was yorker-length which he tried to belt and didn't get any power behind it, easy catch.
swept straight to deep square! It's a first-baller. What have you done, Rishabh? Fetched it from outside off, playing against the turn, top-edged and good catch
works this wide of mid-on to get off the mark
hit on the pad as this breaks back in sharply, Kohli was looking to work this square on the leg side
drilled past mid-off. In his half and he just belted that
flicks this straight to midwicket
uses the pace to run this down to third man
slower ball down leg, rolls to the keeper
incoming length ball, pushed to midwicket
full on the pads, eased to long-on
once again angles this down to third man
flat-bats this down to long-on
turns this to midwicket with the spin
flicks, uppish but straight to midwicket again
excellent diving stop at midwicket by Hetmyer, moving swiftly to his left to stop the flick
slices the drive to point, Kohli struggling to force the pace. Slow surface and all that
chops this cut to deep point
driven through the line, beats mid-off. Sublime timing. Made such a sweet sound as he made contact. Imperious
arches back and runs this down to third man, didn't bounce as much as he expected though
walks across and whips this to deep square
slower bouncer on off, dabbed to third man again
walks across to defend this incoming length ball back
rises with the bounce and angles this down to third man again
welcome, Mr Brathwaite. Kohli steps out and flays this length ball over point! Opened the bat face a hint to pick the gap
whips this full toss down to long-on
fuller outside off, laced to deep point off the frontfoot
incoming slower ball, which Kohli dabs wide of the keeper and scampers a quick single
slower and fuller on middle and leg, wristed to long-on
punched on the up, one bounce to cover
full toss on middle and leg, whipped to deep midwicket
whipped one bounce to long-on. Went full again, looking to attack the stumps
slower and fuller outside off this time, forced off the frontfoot into the gap at sweeper cover
full, straight and gone! Pandey looks to drill this back past but is beaten for pace as the off-stump takes a walk. Ended up yorking himself.
beaten for pace, gloves this pull that rolls to short square leg
works this full ball to long-on
fuller, tossed up on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
moves across to cover the stumps and punch this from off to midwicket
fuller, doesn't get the timing right on the drive to cover
tossed up a bit more, comes forward and gets across to flick this to long-on
flattish on leg, tried to tickle it fine, takes the pad to short fine leg
nicely driven from the stumps to long-off
hops back to get on top of the bounce and defend
nicely on top of the bounce as he turns this back towards the bowler
eases this length delivery into the off side
right into the blockhole, squeezes this wide of mid-on for a single

he's top-edged the pull straight to midwicket. Is this an opening for the West Indies? Absolute lack of pace does Kohli in as he looks to pull from way outside off. Perhaps not the best shot but well, the surface can play tricks. The bowler rolled his fingers across the seam, gave Kohli absolutely no pace to work with. He's bitterly disappointed with himself. Match on!
slips in a yorker-length delivery but down leg, wide called. Jadeja overbalanced as he tried to tickle it fine
another full ball that is ill-directed, way down leg
ease wide of point, third man comes around to cut that off, excellent running
slashed down to third man off a thick outside edge
driven firmly into the gap at deep cover, misfield too from Ewin Lewis. Clumsy. What should've been two is now three

picks the length early and hammers this pull in front of square, clears Hetmyer at midwicket. Skipper Brathwaite runs across all the way from mid-on to pull it back at deep midwicket. Slow outfield because of the rain we had in the build-up to the game
eased with the angle to fine leg

pulled imperiously this time, he's clobbered this or what? Acres of open space at seep square. This sat up nicely, not much pace this time from Oshane. For all that effort, the output was far from desired and Krunal was ready to take full toll

nearly dragged on! Was aware this was about to roll back and quickly tried to get his bat to block the path of the ball. Luckily the ball stopped as it spun around for a bit. Went for a big booming drive, cramped for room, length a touch too full too.
eased to long-off
drives this full ball to deep cover
controls this pull to midwicket
full toss, he reaches out to squeeze this to third man
can't get much bat on this pull, rolls to short fine leg

the off-stump is knocked back! It's the late swing that has done the trick. Angles this in full from wide of the crease, Krunal is looking to work it through midwicket but then the ball wickedly moves away off the seam to square him up and hit the top of middle
slower length ball angling in, tucked to fine leg
slower and fuller on the stumps, gets a leading edge that rolls to point
on the pads, flicked to deep square
right into the blockhole, squeezed back
edged, races to third man who is fine
gets well forward and defends back towards the bowler
attempted yorker that turns into a full toss, bunted to point

walloped over long-on and India win! Fabulous strike from Washington in Florida! Short of length, angling in and he just slapped it cross-batted with an air of disdain. Held his shape briefly and then put it when he intended it to play.
